required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Dose-ranging Study With Brivaracetam in Patients From 16 to 65 Years With Refractory Partial Onset Seizures.
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, 4 Parallel Groups, Dose-ranging Trial Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of Brivaracetam Used as Adjunctive Treatment at Doses of 5, 20 and 50 mg/Day in b.i.d. Administration (Oral Tablets of 2.5 or 10 mg) for a Maximum of 7 Weeks in Subjects From 16 to 65 Years With Refractory Epilepsy Suffering From Partial Onset Seizures Whether or Not Secondarily Generalized

brief_summary.textblock: This trial will evaluate the efficacy and safety of brivaracetam (at doses of 5, 20 and 50 mg/day in twice a day administration) as add-on therapy in subjects with focal epilepsy.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Partial Onset Seizure Frequency Per Week During the 7-week Treatment Period
primary_outcome.description: Calculated as 7-day partial onset seizure frequency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in Partial Onset Seizure Frequency Per Week (Type I) Over the 7-week Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated as 7-day seizure frequency during the 7-week Treatment Period - 7-day seizure frequency during the Baseline Period, divided by the 7-day seizure frequency during the Baseline Period with this quantity multiplied by 100. A negative value in percent change from Baseline indicates a decrease in partial seizure frequency from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Seizure Frequency Per Week for All Seizures (Types I +II +III) Over the Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Types I+II+III seizure frequency (Type I: Partial (focal, local), Type II: Generalized (convulsive or nonconvulsive), Type III: Unclassified) per week will be derived from the seizure count information recorded on the daily record card (e.g. date, number, type of epileptic seizures) and is defined as the number of seizures standardized to a 7-day period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in Seizure Frequency Per Week for Partial Onset Seizures (Type I) Over the Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated as 7-day Partial Onset Seizures (Type I) frequency during the 7-week Treatment Period 7-day seizure frequency during the Baseline Period. A negative value from Baseline indicates a decrease in partial seizure frequency from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in Seizure Frequency Per Week for All Seizures (Types I + II + III) Over the Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated as 7-day seizure frequency during the 7-week Treatment Period 7-day seizure (Types I + II + III) frequency during the Baseline Period. A negative value from Baseline indicates a decrease in partial seizure frequency from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in Seizure Frequency Per Week for All Seizures (Types I + II + III) Over the Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated as 7-day seizure frequency during the 7-week Treatment Period - 7-day seizure frequency during the Baseline Period, divided by the 7-day seizure frequency during the Baseline Period with this quantity multiplied by 100. A negative value in percent change from Baseline indicates a decrease in partial seizure frequency from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Responder Rate in Partial Onset Seizures (Type I) Over the Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: A responder was defined as a subject with a >= 50 % reduction in seizure frequency per week from the Baseline Period to the end of the Treatment Period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Categorized Response to the Treatment in Partial Onset Seizures (Type I) Over the Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Categories of percentage reductions in seizures from baseline were as following: < -25 %; -25 % to <25 %; 25 % to <75 %; 75 % to <100 %; 100 %.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Who Are Seizure Free During the 7-week Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: A subject was considered seizure free, if no seizure was reported during the 7-week Treatment Period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seizure-free Days Per 4 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: A day was considered seizure-free, if no seizure was reported during 24 hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Nth (n= 1, 5, 10) Seizure During the 7-week Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days to first, fifth, and tenth seizure after baseline.

arm_group.description: Matching Placebo tablets administered twice a day
Brivaracetam 5 mg/day, 2.5 mg administered twice a day
Brivaracetam 20 mg/day, 10 mg administered twice a day
Brivaracetam 50 mg/day, 25 mg administered twice a day

intervention.description: Daily oral dose of two equal intakes, morning and evening, of Placebo in a double-blinded way for the 7-week Treatment Period
Daily oral dose of two equal intakes, morning and evening, of Brivaracetam over the 7-week Treatment Period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male/female from 16 to 65 years
- Well-characterized focal epilepsy or epileptic syndrome according to the International League Against Epilepsy (ILAE) classification
- History of partial onset seizures
- Subjects having at least 4 partial onset seizures during the 4-week Baseline Period and at least 2 partial onset seizures during the 3 months prior to Visit 1
- Subjects taking 1 or 2 concomitant Antiepileptic drugs (AED(s)) that have been at a stable dose.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Seizure type IA non-motor as only seizure type
- Seizures occurring only in clusters
- Status epilepticus during the last 2 years before Visit 1
- History of cerebrovascular accident (CVA)
- Presence of any sign suggesting rapidly progressing brain disorder or brain tumor

results_reference.citation: Toledo M, Whitesides J, Schiemann J, Johnson ME, Eckhardt K, McDonough B, Borghs S, Kwan P. Safety, tolerability, and seizure control during long-term treatment with adjunctive brivaracetam for partial-onset seizures. Epilepsia. 2016 Jul;57(7):1139-51. doi: 10.1111/epi.13416. Epub 2016 Jun 6.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study started to enroll patients in November 2005 and concluded in June 2006.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participant Flow refers to the Intention-to-treat (ITT) Set. 210 subjects were initially randomized, 2 subjects discontinued due to Lost to Follow-Up before first study drug intake.

analysis.groups_desc: ANCOVA with baseline seizure frequency per week and each of the stratification factors as independent variables.
ANCOVA with baseline seizure frequency per week and each of the stratification factors as independent variables.
ANCOVA with baseline seizure frequency per week and each of the stratification factors as independent variables.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected from Baseline until Safety Visit (up to 3 months).
reported_events.desc: Adverse Events refer to the Safety Population consisting of all subjects who were dispensed medication.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
